channel.title: TravelCommons
channel.description: The Frequent Traveler's Podcast. The voice of the frequent traveler -- it's more about the journey than the destination
channel.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
channel.itunes:summary: The Frequent Traveler's Podcast. The voice of the frequent traveler -- it's more about the journey than the destination
channel.itunes:keywords: travel, travel podcast, business travel, travel stories, travel industry, travel tips, road warrior

item.title: Show Me the Proof; Hereditary Road Warriors
item.description:
No Thanksgiving travel, but looking at the travel volume for this, the busiest travel week of the year, shows just how far things have fallen. The Qantas CEO said “No vax, no fly”, so we dig into the emerging world of digital vaccine passports. And then I trace my travel genealogy, wondering if road warrior-ism is hereditary.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Thanksgiving travel volume shows how far things have fallen; we dig into digital vaccine passports; tracing my travel genealogy, is road warrior-ism hereditary?
item.itunes:summary: Thanksgiving travel volume shows how far things have fallen; we dig into digital vaccine passports; tracing my travel genealogy, is road warrior-ism hereditary?
item.itunes:keywords: Coronavirus, Covid-19, Digital Vaccine Passports, Holiday Travel, Hotel Room Cooking, Hyatt, O’Hare International Airport, Road Warriors, Siri, Thanksgiving, Vaccination, travel stories, travel tips, travel podcast

item.title: Pandemic Holiday Gift Guide; Year-End Status Offers
item.description:
No travel since the last episode, so I had some time to think back through my post-lockdown travel and come up with my top 10 gift ideas for your pandemic travelers. We look at the start of the year-end efforts by airlines, hotels, and credit card companies to keep their grounded travelers, unpack the work-from-hotel offerings from Marriott, Hilton, and Hyatt, and dissect the latest hotel reservation system data breach.
Check out this episode's show notes here
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Top 10 gift ideas for pandemic travelers; year-end status offers from airlines, hotels, and travel credit cards; work-from-hotel offerings; latest hotel reservation system data breach.
item.itunes:summary: Top 10 gift ideas for pandemic travelers; year-end status offers from airlines, hotels, and travel credit cards; work-from-hotel offerings; latest hotel reservation system data breach.
item.itunes:keywords: travel gift ideas, best travel gift ideas, travel gifts, gift ideas for travelers, best travel gifts, gift for traveler, travel accessories, travel stories, travel tips, travel podcast, frequent flyer status, frequent flier status, travel credit cards

item.title: Surviving Quarantine Theater; Traveling for Food
item.description: Trying to recover from a long weekend of eating and drinking through the neighborhoods of South Philly. Our movable feast reminded me that food may be the one experience of a place left that can’t be easily exported and bought on-line. We talk about the FBI’s cybersecurity warning to work-from-home types using hotels for getaway offices, and are a bit amazed at how fast last year’s 'flight shaming' gave way to 'flights to nowhere.' And we think about 'quarantine theater' — how cities and states are focusing on activities to signal they are serious about COVID, but that most folks know aren’t really effective.
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:subtitle: Eating local in South Philly and the UP; FBI cybersecurity warning on working from hotels; ‘flight shaming’ gives way to ‘flights to nowhere’; signaling concern about COVID does nothing but hassles travelers
item.itunes:summary: Eating local in South Philly and the UP; FBI cybersecurity warning on working from hotels; ‘flight shaming’ gives way to ‘flights to nowhere’; signaling concern about COVID does nothing but hassles travelers
item.itunes:keywords: Chicago, Coronavirus, Covid-19, Cyber Security, FBI, Flight Shaming, food, Hygiene Theater, Maine, Michigan, Pasties, Philadelphia, Quarantine, Quarantine Theater, Upper Peninsula, VPN, Travel Stories, Travel Tips, Travel Podcast

item.title: 6 Months On; Why Keep Travel Cards?
item.description: Drivable getaway to Michigan's Upper Peninsula; looking back 6 months to start of pandemic; downloading 12 years of TripIt data; what to do with travel card points we can't use?
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: Drivable getaway to Michigan's Upper Peninsula; looking back 6 months to start of pandemic; downloading 12 years of TripIt data; what to do with travel card points we can't use?
item.itunes:summary: Spent a week in Michigan's Upper Peninsula hiking, biking, kayaking, and running into a lot of other people getting away to do the same, which got me looking back six months to the start of the pandemic. I talk about a surprisingly good flight cancellation experience with American Airlines, and figuring out how to download 12 years of TripIt data. We wrap up talking to Matt Schulz of LendingTree, asking him what are we doing with travel credit cards that are generating frequent traveler points we can’t use?
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: American Airlines, Barcelona, business travel, Covid-19, Credit Cards, Delta Airlines, Leisure Travel, Michigan, SkyMiles, travel planning, travel podcast, travel stories, travel tips, Trip Cancellation, TripIt, Upper Peninsula

item.title: What Is The Meaning of Travel?
item.description: Travel planning amidst changing quarantines and lockdowns; writing off Barcelona trip; Emily Thomas and her new book "The Meaning of Travel: Philosophers Abroad"
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: Travel planning amidst changing quarantines and lockdowns; writing off Barcelona trip; Emily Thomas and her new book "The Meaning of Travel: Philosophers Abroad"
item.itunes:summary: Trying to plan an August trip amidst dueling state quarantine lists and rapid lockdown changes while writing off my September plans for Barcelona. What's worse - hotels cutting back on housekeeping or breakfasts? And talking with Emily Thomas about her new book "The Meaning of Travel: Philosophers Abroad".
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: American Airlines, Barcelona, breakfast, Cabin Porn, Coronavirus, Covid-19, Emily Thomas, Henry David Thoreau, Hotels, Meaning of Travel, Philosophy, Timbuk2, Travel Itinerary, travel planning, travel podcast, travel tips

item.title: First Post-Lockdown Flight; When Does Business Travel Come Back?
item.description: Experiences on my first post-lockdown flight; Hertz's new cleaning program; reviewing my new pair of Bose headphones, wonder when business travel will return
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: Experiences on my first post-lockdown flight; Hertz's new cleaning program; reviewing my new pair of Bose headphones, wonder when business travel will return
item.itunes:summary: My first post-lockdown flight was a 90-minute Southwest non-stop from Chicago to Nashville. It wasn't bad, but not as casually easy as my last pre-coronavirus flight in February. We talk about that experience as well as Hertz's new cleaning program, my latest pair of Bose noise-cancelling headphones, and then wonder when business travel will return
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: Bose Headphones, business travel, Cashless, Coronavirus, Covid-19, Facial Recognition, Hertz, iPhone, Lockdown, Midway Airport, Nashville, Southwest Airlines, travel stories, travel tips, travel podcast

item.title: First Post-Lockdown Trips; Travel Credit Cards
item.description: First post-lockdown trip, a fast drive down I-65. Talk about hotels swapping hospitality for sanitation, Hertz's bankruptcy, tips for travel credit card usage
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: First post-lockdown trip, a fast drive down I-65. Talk about hotels swapping hospitality for sanitation, Hertz's bankruptcy, tips for travel credit card usage
item.itunes:summary: I broke Chicago's containment for my first post-lockdown trip, a fast drive down I-65. We talk about hotels swapping hospitality for sanitation, Hertz's bankruptcy, and tips for travel credit card usage
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: American Airlines, Coronavirus, Covid-19, Credit Cards, Delta Airlines, Driving, Hertz, Hilton, MD-80, road trip, travel planning, travel podcast, travel stories, travel tips

item.title: New World of Travel Insurance; Getting Medical Help On The Road
item.description: People are doing short car trips. Before doing more extensive travel, they'll want more spacing in aircraft, travel insurance, and finding medical attention on the road
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: People are doing short car trips. Before doing more extensive travel, they'll want more spacing in aircraft, travel insurance, and finding medical attention on the road
item.itunes:summary: Though I'm still locked down on the shores of Lake Michigan, data shows that people are starting to do short car trips. We talk about what people will need to feel comfortable to do more extensive travel - spacing in aircraft, and putting a higher priority on travel insurance and finding medical attention.
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: Coronavirus, Covid-19, Doctor, Frontier Airlines, Lockdown, road trip, Thailand, Travel Clinic, Travel Insurance, travel planning, travel stories

item.title: Post-Corona Trip Planning; Keeping a Travel Journal
item.description: Cyberattacks on frequent flyer accounts now that we aren't checking them; planning my post-pandemic trips; re-reading my travel journals provides a travel fix
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: Cyberattacks on frequent flyer accounts now that we aren't checking them; planning my post-pandemic trips; re-reading my travel journals provides a travel fix
item.itunes:summary: Kinda tough to do a podcast that’s more about the journey than the destination if I’m not “journeying,” but I give it a go. We talk about cyberattacks on frequent flyer accounts now that we don’t have a reason to check them, planning for my first post-pandemic trips, and how re-reading my travel journals is pinch-hitting right now.
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: Coronavirus, Covid-19, Cyber Security, frequent flyer programs, Frequent Flyer Status, Marriott, road trip, Travel Notebooks, travel planning, travel stories

item.title: New Crisis, Old Question; Driving Down to Key West
item.description: Things started out well, skipping out on Chicago winter for a drive down to Key West. But then last week, coronavirus hit the US and everything unraveled
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: Things started out well, skipping out on Chicago winter for a drive down to Key West. But then last week, coronavirus hit the US and everything unraveled
item.itunes:summary: Things started out well, skipping out on Chicago winter for a drive down to Key West. But then last week, coronavirus hit the US and everything unraveled.

item.title: Looking Back Over Four Years of TravelCommons
item.description: The fourth year anniversary episode of TravelCommons
item.author: mpeacock@travelcommons.com (Mark Peacock)
item.itunes:subtitle: The fourth year anniversary episode of TravelCommons
item.itunes:summary: Recorded in the Seattle Marriott Waterfront, this special 4th-year anniversary edition collates the best bits from four years of TravelCommons podcasts. Starting with the "hotel medley" -- the roll call of all the hotels that have served as TravelCommons recording studios, we move on to excerpts from stories about the TSA, Bose headphones, memories of better airplane food, the hassles of travel, and some of the most entertaining sights I've seen in the last four years.
item.itunes:author: Mark Peacock
item.itunes:keywords: travel, business travel, travel stories, anniversary show
